de.lambeck.pned.models

Interface IModel

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IDataModel, IGuiModel
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DataModel, GuiModel

    public interface IModel
    Interface for models representing a Petri net.
    Author:
    Thomas Lambeck, 4128320

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getModelName

        java.lang.String getModelName()
        Returns the full name of this model. This should be the canonical (unique) path name of the file.
        Returns:
        The full name

      • getDisplayName

        java.lang.String getDisplayName()
        Returns the display name of this model.

        Intended use: name of the tab
        Returns:
        The display name

      • isModified

        boolean isModified()
        Returns true if this model has been modified, otherwise false.
        Returns:
        The current modified state of the model

      • setModified

        void setModified(boolean b)
        Sets the "modified" attribute of this model. Use this method when changing persistent data (e.g. name and position of nodes).

        Note: It should also be used by the model controller to reset the "modified" attribute after loading a PNML file. Otherwise: The model would be marked as "modified" before the user has modified anything.
        Parameters:
        b - The new state

      • addPlace

        void addPlace(java.lang.String id,
              EPlaceToken initialTokens,
              java.awt.Point position)
        Adds a place to this model.

        Intended use: adding a place after a GUI event when the new place is without a name after creation.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the place
        initialTokens - The initial tokens count of the place
        position - The position (center) of the place

      • addPlace

        void addPlace(java.lang.String id,
              java.lang.String name,
              EPlaceToken initialTokens,
              java.awt.Point position)
        Adds a place to this model.

        Note: Adds an additional parameter name to the other method addPlace(String id, EPlaceTokens initialTokens, Point position)

        Intended use: adding a place after reading from a PNML file because these places may have a name.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the place
        name - The name of the place
        initialTokens - The initial tokens count of the place
        position - The position (center) of the place

      • addTransition

        void addTransition(java.lang.String id,
                   java.awt.Point position)
        Adds a transition to this model.

        Intended use: adding a transition after a GUI event when the new transition is without a name after creation.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the transition
        position - The position (center) of the transition

      • addTransition

        void addTransition(java.lang.String id,
                   java.lang.String name,
                   java.awt.Point position)
        Adds a transition to this model.

        Note: Adds an additional parameter name to the other method addTransition(String id, Point position)

        Intended use: adding a transition after reading from a PNML file because these transitions may have a name.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the transition
        name - The name of the transition
        position - The position (center) of the transition

      • addArc

        void addArc(java.lang.String id,
            java.lang.String sourceId,
            java.lang.String targetId)
        Adds an arc to this model.

        Note: This method should be the same for GUI events and reading from a PNML file because arcs will have all 3 attributes in both cases.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the arc
        sourceId - The id of the source (Place or Transition)
        targetId - The id of the target (Place or Transition)

      • removeElement

        void removeElement(java.lang.String id)
            throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Removes the specified element from this model.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the element
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if element does not exist

      • clear

        void clear()
        Removes all elements from this model.
